intro: Bouvardia erecta, commonly known as the pink bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped, pink or white flowers. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light. Bouvardia erecta is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive blooms and compact growth habit.
